org.opensha2.eq.model

Class AreaSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensha2.eq.model.AreaSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Rupture>, Source, Named

    public class AreaSource
extends Object
implements Source
    Area source representation. An AreaSource represents a region over which there is a equal likelihood of earthquake occurrence, as specified by a single IncrementalMfd.

    Internally, an AreaSource distributes ruptures over a grid of point Sources; the resolution of the grid may scale with distance from a site according to the assigned AreaSource.GridScaling. An AreaSource therefore supplies an iterableForLocation(Location). If no location-dependent scaling is specified, this custom Iterable's iterator() behaves the same as the built-in iterator(). If the specified scaling is location-dependent, the standard iterator() returns ruptures derived from 0.1° spaced sources.

    Author:
    Peter Powers

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AreaSource.GridScaling
      Point source discretization scaling.

      Return a Rupture iterator over distributed point Sources whose spacing is a function of the distance from the supplied Location.
      Iterator<Rupture> iterator()
      For non-uniform GridScaling, this iterator returns ruptures derived from 0.1° spaced sources.
      String name()
      Returns an object's display name.
      int size()
      The number of Ruptures for an AreaSource will vary if GridScaling is non-uniform.

      • size

        public int size()
        The number of Ruptures for an AreaSource will vary if GridScaling is non-uniform. In such cases, this method returns the number of ruptures that would be expected from 0.1° spaced point sources.
        Specified by:
        size in interface Source
